p.s: Ever dealt with someone who cannot put anything in concrete terms ?
Someone who speaks big words and has a broad image of how the world works , but whenever you try to get specifics out of them , it 's like herding cats ?

item.s: Take stock of the individual 's relevance / importance for your everyday life .
The more important the person is the more you should make an effort to relate to them ( and them to you ) .

figure.rend: Get Along With Conceptual Thinkers Step 1.jpg

item.s: For example , is it important to convey to your dad what your college major classes are about ?

If this matters to you think about " transferable skills " and important lessons you learn - your dad may not care to know about the second derivative problem you failed on the exam if he 's a conceptual thinker and not a math-whiz .
Do you need to explain to your roommate why you need to be alone on Friday night in the apartment ?
If he or she is a conceptual thinker they will be confused by all your literal ( and detailed ) Friday evening plans .
Hearing concepts such as " privacy " , " personal space " , " date " , " movie night " may be more important to them than the details of who your date is or what movie you are planning to see .

figure.rend: Get Along With Conceptual Thinkers Step 2.jpg

item.s: If you are planning to do something with them , patiently and respectfully of your thinking styles try to get them to commit to concrete steps or specifics about what will you do .

For example , if your friend talks about " big life change " plans , get her or him to commit to running once a week with you , start an online dating profile , or pick up the call and inquire about open position about her or his dream job .
Conceptual thinkers sometimes have a hard time making their plans concrete because they need to think about details .
Help them ( and they can help you think in conceptual terms about your business idea , or your career/ life plans ) .

figure.rend: Get Along With Conceptual Thinkers Step 3.jpg

list.item:
Conceptual and literal thinkers may have a hard time getting along but , with the right communication skills and patience , they can be wonderful life or work partners .
Think for example of CEO-COO teams : the CEO is in change of vision , mission , inspiring people ; the COO spends time on the nitty-gritty of everyday life .
Both are important , and the two have to work together as a team : mission without good execution is bad , and so is execution without good , clear mission .

You may be one of them in which case conceptual thinkers will make you very uncomfortable with their high-level ideas .
Working with someone of an opposite thinking type can be both a blessing and a curse ( and sometimes both at the same time ) .
Learn to recognize and use each other 's strengths .
